docs.text: the success of beyond rangoon hinges on the believability of patricia arquette ( ed wood , true romance ) as the busty westerner-in-peril wandering about 1988 burma without a passport .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: though we can stomach the mild plot contrivances that get her there , it's a tougher task to overlook the actress .

docs.text: she's a lightweight .

docs.label: negative

docs.text: demonstrates , she doesn't have * nearly * enough range for the emotions that her character--a mother fleeing the memories of a murdered husband and son--is supposed to show .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she may give a stronger performance than , say , keanu reeves in a walk in the clouds , by not by much .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: beyond rangoon is a very physically appealing film , thanks to the practiced craftsmanship of john boorman ( deliverance , excalibur , hope and glory ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he keeps the narrative moving , no matter how muddy the story--or the heroine--gets .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: why he chose arquette remains a mystery , though .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: maybe he was thinking that the dramatic weight of the story would overcome any casting deficiencies .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but even after an hour of half-stated political statements and murky mass killings , we * still * don't know enough of what's happening in this country to feel distressed for the characters or their situations .
